newsitem.title: USA: U.S. carmakers meeting with Clinton canceled.
newsitem.headline: U.S. carmakers meeting with Clinton canceled.

text.p: A meeting between President Clinton and the the chief executives of the Big Three U.S. automobile makers that had been scheduled for this week has been canceled, an industry spokesman said Tuesday.

The chief executives of Chrysler Corp, Ford and General Motors Corp and the president of the United Auto Workers Union were scheduled to meet with Clinton on Thursday. They were expected to discuss their concerns about the impact of weak Japanese yen and strong U.S. dollar on U.S. auto sales. The group was also expected to discuss concerns about global negotiations to curb carbon emissions as well.
A Ford spokesman said the meeting has not been rescheduled.
